casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. James Patrick TAYLOR, Appellant. No. 26397. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. May 10, 1971. *1328Catherine Chandler (argued), Asst. U. S. Atty., Harry Steward, U. S. Atty., Robert H. Filsinger, Chief, Crim. Div., San Diego, Cal., for plaintiff-appellee. Charles Khoury, Jr. (argued), San Diego, Cal., for appellant.

Before CHAMBERS, KOELSCH and TRASK, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The judgment of conviction for failure to carry a Selective Service card is affirmed. (Taylor had turned it in to the draft board.)

He was convicted of violating a duty imposed upon him by Selective Service regulations authorized by statute. We hold that the regulation was valid and a violation thereof a crime.

He was obligated to carry some card and he carried none.
